meanings.definition: A Greek god of mockery and satire.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Greek mythology, Momus was known for his sharp wit and clever jokes.
meanings.sent2: The statue of Momus in the museum depicted him holding a mask of comedy and a quill for writing satire.
meanings.sent3: At the toga party, John dressed up as Momus and entertained everyone with his funny impersonations.
meanings.sent4: Her words cut through the tension in the room like Momus's sharp tongue in a comedy show.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's humor was as cutting as the wit of Momus himself.

meanings.definition: A person who habitually finds fault with and criticizes others.
meanings.sent1: Sarah's brother always plays the role of Momus, pointing out flaws in everyone's plans.
meanings.sent2: The teacher warned the students not to be a Momus and instead focus on positive feedback.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, Tom couldn't help but channel his inner Momus and critique every idea presented.
meanings.sent4: Her constant nagging made her seem like a real-life Momus, always ready to criticize.
meanings.sent5: The movie critic's reviews were so harsh, he was dubbed the Momus of the film industry.
